content:
Diagnosis:		Metastatic prostate adenocarcinoma, initial diagnosis 2012

Histology:	High-grade disease, Gleason Score 9 (4+5)
		Initial staging MRI: T3a disease with extracapsular extension
		Baseline PSA 11.2 ng/mL

Treatment history:	Completed definitive external beam radiotherapy 70Gy/35# March 2013
		Concurrent androgen deprivation therapy with goserelin
		Developed nodal recurrence (right external iliac chain) on surveillance PET-CT November 2014
		Interval progression noted February 2015 with new right pelvic sidewall adenopathy
		Enrolled in PRESIDE trial May 2016 - evidence of disease progression during period one

Current situation:	Currently receiving docetaxel chemotherapy as part of PRESIDE trial protocol

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 2 of protocol treatment. His general condition remains satisfactory with no significant chemotherapy-related toxicities reported. Performance status is maintained at 1.

He has recently completed a course of ciprofloxacin for complicated urinary tract infection, with good clinical response after 7 days of therapy.

The predominant clinical issue remains right-sided sciatica-type pain. Recent bone scintigraphy and plain radiographs have not demonstrated clear evidence of skeletal metastases, though given the persistent symptoms, we will proceed with dedicated MRI lumbar spine and pelvis for further evaluation.

Clinical examination today was unremarkable. Chest was clear to auscultation. No palpable lymphadenopathy. No focal neurological deficits identified.

Providing today's blood results are satisfactory, we will proceed with cycle 2 chemotherapy as scheduled next week. Follow-up arranged in three weeks with repeat biochemistry and PSA measurement. The patient has emergency contact details and understands to report any concerning symptoms promptly.

primary_cancer.metastases: right external iliac and pelvic sidewall lymph nodes

cancer_timeline.value: Started androgen deprivation therapy with goserelin
Nodal recurrence in right external iliac chain on PET-CT
Progression with new right pelvic sidewall adenopathy
Disease progression during PRESIDE trial period one
Started docetaxel chemotherapy on PRESIDE trial protocol

patient_facts.value: Chest clear to auscultation, no palpable lymphadenopathy, no focal neurological deficits

status_updates.value: Metastatic prostate cancer with nodal progression, currently on trial protocol chemotherapy. Stable clinical condition with persistent right-sided pain requiring further investigation.
completed course of ciprofloxacin for complicated urinary tract infection
proceed with cycle 2 chemotherapy next week
Follow-up arranged in three weeks with repeat biochemistry and PSA measurement
